title: A Ramen Master Sets His Sights on the Corner Slice - The New York Times
text: Continue reading the main story Photo Michael Bergemann is the chef and a partner in Corner Slice, Ivan Orkin’s next venture at Gotham West Market in Manhattan. Credit Emon Hassan for The New York Times Ivan Orkin , whose Slurp Shop for ramen is a popular draw in the Gotham West Market, is opening his second venture there, Corner Slice. This Italian takeout counter has coffee drinks and a concise selection of pizzas, sandwiches and pastries. “At most places that sell coffee, you can’t get real food, so you could call this a throwback, diner-style,” Mr. Orkin said. His chef and a partner, Michael Bergemann, uses organic spelt, durum and bread flours for the thin-crust pizzas (tomato, cheese and white with additional topping options) and other baked goods, all made on the premises. The stand, which sells La Colombe coffee, replaces the Blue Bottle Coffee outlet. Opens on Feb. 28: Corner Slice, Gotham West Market, 600 11th Avenue (45th Street), 212-956-9339, cornerslicenyc.com .
